definition: to get up/to leave/to set forth

to rise/to raise/to get up/to set out/to start/to appear/to launch/to initiate (action)/to draft/to establish/to get (from a depot or counter)/verb suffix, to start/starting from (a time, place, price etc)/classifier for occurrences or unpredictable events: case, instance/classifier for groups: batch, group
body/life/oneself/personally/one's morality and conduct/the main part of a structure or body/pregnant/classifier for sets of clothes: suit, twinset/Kangxi radical 158

sentences.english: Then David rose and went down to the wilderness of Paran.
sentences.chinese: 大衛起身，下到巴蘭的曠野。

sentences.english: She rose from her seat to watch him.
sentences.chinese: 現在她從樹樁上站起身來看他。

sentences.english: At once I stood up and said it was too inconvenient, I then walked quickly to follow him.
sentences.chinese: 我立即起身說那太麻煩了，就疾步跟過去。

sentences.english: She rose to her feet and gazed upon him, round-eyed.
sentences.chinese: 她站起身，直愣愣地看着他，眼睛瞪得圓圓的。

sentences.english: My friend was on her feet now, with one unbelieving hand against her mouth.
sentences.chinese: 我的朋友不禁站起身，驚訝得用手捂住了嘴巴。

sentences.english: He Finally got up and, throwing off his clothes, climbed into his iron cot.
sentences.chinese: 最後他站起身來，把衣服一脫，爬到鐵牀上。

sentences.english: He got up abruptly and tried to see himself in the dirty looking- glass over the wash-stand.
sentences.chinese: 他猛然站起身來，想在盟洗臺的骯髒鏡子裏看看自己。

sentences.english: He stood up and drew the curtains to let in the pale glint of dawn.
sentences.chinese: 他起身拉開窗簾，讓黎明的翕光射進房間。

sentences.english: Pushing aside the stack of paper, I got up.
sentences.chinese: 我把那疊文件往旁邊推了推，站起身來。

sentences.english: Abruptly he Sat. upright in his chair and, with an effort of will, expunged his downcast mood.
sentences.chinese: 突然，他在椅子上直起身來，努力趕走沮喪的情緒。

sentences.english: "I remember, " I answered her and got up from the cushioned seat.
sentences.chinese: “我記得，”我答道，然後從軟墊椅起身。

sentences.english: Had he got up little earlier, he would not have missed the train.
sentences.chinese: 要是他早一點起身的話，他本來可以不誤車的。

sentences.english: The angered witch got up and went to Clemencia's bedroom.
sentences.chinese: 巫婆的憤怒起身前往克萊門的臥室。

sentences.english: She just stands up laughing, kicking the mosquito-incense holder back under the table.
sentences.chinese: 她只是笑吟吟地站起身來，將蚊香盤踢到桌子底下”。

sentences.english: At this point Shasta got up and tiptoed away.
sentences.chinese: 沙斯塔聽到這兒便站起身來，掂着腳走開了。

sentences.english: Zeus stood up to shake off the dung pellet, and the eggs were thrown to the ground without his thinking.
sentences.chinese: 宙斯站起身來抖落糞蛋，沒留神把鷹卵也抖掉了。

definition: to get up on hind legs (esp. of horse)/to stand/to spring up
to stand up
(of a person) to turn round/to face about/(of a widow) to remarry (archaic)
to sit down
to turn one's head/to turn around
nutation (plants turning to face the sun)
to turn one's head/to change direction/U-turn/volte face/to repent
to hurry/to hasten/to make haste
promptly/at once
hastily
to say goodbye/to take one's leave
in a great rush/in a flurry
to stoop
to wave (one's hand)
to leave/to walk away/to beat it/to move aside
to be just about to/to be on the point of
quick step
